pros: Great Opportunities, and a great sense of community.
cons: There are no negatives I can think of.

pros: Wonderful Christian environment, very kind people. I really respect my colleagues.
cons: Adjunct Professors are pretty much screwed here. In the 14 years I have worked here, I have never seen an adjunct get a full professor dedignation. Adjuncts here are paid only anywhere from $623-650 per credit hour which amounts to peanuts, even before taxes are taken out. I am a PhD and teach 9 credits each semester - I net only $1460 per month before taxes. This is way below average for other adjuncts in the area. If you don’t mind basically being a “volunteer” for this University, then this is the place for you.

review_title: Everyone was so helpful during my time at the college while I was a student and worked in the student services office
pros: Flexibility while continuing your education and opportunities to help students and other departments through out the college.  Lots of experience assisting incoming students and the ability to share what you liked about the college from a students perspective.
cons: As a student worker not enough hours or benefits.  Need to offer internship opportunities on campus for education and interior design students, also opportunities to be student teachers in a college setting as well.

pros: The mission is social justice and this is discussed through presentations and workshops throughout campus.  Many women work at the campus, but it is also very welcoming to men.  People tend to support each other and help each other out.  The people that work at Mount Mary are genuine.
cons: Salaries tend to be low and there does not seem to be a sense to obtain equal pay to similar schools in the near future.

review_title: Close-knit, but tough to work for
pros: Close-knit community, collaborating with the SSNDs
cons: Employees are extremely undervalued and underpaid.  Professional development is not a priority.

pros: Coworkers were great, they were very flexible and understood about having to take time off.  Hours were great, worked mornings and had afternoons to enjoy the great Wisconsin summer
cons: Management was very disorganized.  They lacked certain tools and equipment to get jobs done in a timely and effective manner.

pros: Everyone cares about the students and the staff are like a family.  The campus is beautiful and parking is free.
cons: Pay is low and the job titles do not match the work required.  Many managers have been in their position for years and don't know how to manage.
